comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: "As early as 1907, the YWCA's national board discussed the issue of racial segregation, and at the 1914 national meeting, the board proclaimed its readiness to meet the special needs of black women and girls. However, the board did not set a national policy, and each local branch operated as it saw fit." www.fundinguniverse.com/company-histories/YWCA-of-the-USA...
